Functions

Variables

declare

Arguments

:: Identifier

The identifier to be declared.

-> Execution ()

Resulting action.

If a symbol identified by the given identifier already exists, a new scope will be added, otherwise the a symbol will be added; however, it will be initiated with NULL.

assign

Arguments

:: Identifier

The identifier to which the number is to be assigned.

-> Expression

The Number to be assigned to the variable.

-> Execution ()

Resulting action.

Assignes the value of the given Number to the top legal scope of the symbol identified by the given identifier.

(.=)

Arguments

:: Identifier

The identifier to which the number is to be assigned.

-> Expression

The Number to be assigned to the variable.

-> Execution ()

Resulting action.

Infix version of assign

eval

Arguments

:: Expression

Expression to be evaluated.

-> Execution Number

Result of the evaluation.

Evaluation of arithmetical expressions.

Construction of functions

buildFunction

Arguments

:: Identifier

Identifier of the Function

-> [Identifier]

List of the function parameter names.

-> Execution ()

The body of the function.

-> Execution ()

The resulting action.

Builds the frame for a new function.

Arguments

:: ErrorMessage

The message returned on failure.

-> Execution a

exitSuccess

Arguments

:: Expression

The value returned on success.

-> Execution a
